## performance:
  * Speed-up of up to 100x compared to CPU-based packages.
  * Very low memory usage easily allows > 10 million FD cells.
 
## included physics:
  * Landau-Lifshitz micromagnetic formalism
  * Magnetostatic field using FFT-accelerated convolution
  * Heisenberg exchange and Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya interaction
  * Arbitrary inter-region exchange like RKKY coupling
  * Spin-transfer torque (Zhang-Li)
  * Uniaxial and cubic magnetocrystalline anisotropy
  * All material parameters can be fully time- and space-dependent
  * Arbitrary complex excitation (field, current)

## bonus features:
  * Simulation window can automatically follow a moving domain wall
  * Nanowire edge charges can be removed to simulate an infinitely long geometry.
  
## web GUI
Browser-based user interface lets you follow a running simulation or modify it on-the-fly.
![Image](http://wiki.mx3.googlecode.com/git/webiface304.png)

## simple scripting
mumax3 provides simple yet powerful input scripting. E.g., the example below applies a time-dependent external field to a uniform magnet (FMR experiment).
```
setgridsize(128, 32, 4)
setcellsize(5e-9, 5e-9, 5e-9)
Msat = 860e3
Aex  = 13e-12
alpha= 0.2
m=uniform(1, 1, 0)

f := 1e9  // 1GHz
A := 0.01 // 10mT
B_ext = vector(0.1, A*sin(2*pi*f*t), 0)

run(10e-9)   
```

mumax3 is written and maintained by Arne Vansteenkiste (a.vansteenkiste@gmail.com), DyNaMat group (http://dynamat.ugent.be), Ghent University, Belgium.
